newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt sets up new gas company, seeks investors.
newsitem.headline: Egypt sets up new gas company, seeks investors.

text.p: Three Egyptian state firms have set up a new gas company and plan to increase the issued capital through a public offer, an official statement said.
"The Egyptian Company for Natural Gases(GASCO) has been established and the first general meeting was held on March 27, 1997,"the oil ministry said in the statement.
Gasco will build, operate and own gas pipelines, distribution facilities and processing plants, the statement said.

Gasco has been set up by the Egyptian General Petroleum Corporation (EGPC), Petrojet and Egypt Gas. It has an issued capital of 221 million pounds ($65 million). The authorised capital is about 1.1 billion pounds.
"Increasing the issued capital is planned by offering a part of the increase through a public offer within the next few months,"the statement said.
Officials were not available to clarify Gasco' capital structure or the volume of the planned increase
Mohamed Ibrahim Taweela, former deputy head of EGPC, was appointed Gasco chairman, it added.
